description: A speech by the first lady touched on race relations as the White House was used for political purposes. It also was the first time a sitting secretary of state addressed a national political convention in at least 75 years.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Queen & Slim and Hamlet
description: QUEEN & SLIM (2019) 9 p.m. on HBO. In the blink of an eye, a sputtering first date turns into a high-stakes run from the law in Queen & Slim, the debut feature from the music-video and television creator Melina Matsoukas. The story begins in an Ohio diner: Queen (Jodie Turner-Smith) and Slim (Daniel Kaluuya) meet for dinner, after connecting via a dating app. Its awkward. On their way home, they are pulled over by a police officer (Sturgill Simpson)  an encounter that turns deadly. Suddenly fugitives, Queen and Slim then run from the law while news of their encounter sparks nationwide attention and protest. The screenplay, by Lena Waithe, taps into urgent conversations about race in America. I dont want this movie to be as relevant as it is, Waithe said in an interview with The New York Times when the film came out. But the scary thing is the movie becomes more and more relevant with every passing day. That was late last year.

title: Trumps Family Praises Him at Convention
description: President Trumps wife, Melania, and two of his children, Eric and Tiffany, spoke lovingly about the president during Night 2 of the Republican National Convention.

title: At R.N.C., Graham Lynch Encourages Free Exercise of Religion
description: Cissie Graham Lynch, a granddaughter of the Rev. Billy Graham, said Americans should never give in to those who want to take away their First Amendment rights.

title: Justice Dept. to Open Investigation Into Kenosha Shooting
description: KENOSHA, Wis.  The Justice Department on Wednesday announced a civil rights investigation into the police shooting of a Black man in Kenosha, Wis., as new details emerged in the case, a white teenager who confronted demonstrators was arrested in connection with two deaths, and protests spread to athletes in three pro sports leagues.

title: I Expected 2020 to Be a Hectic Year at Guantnamo. I Was Wrong.
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together. This article, which was produced in partnership with the Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting, first appeared in the At War newsletter. Sign up here to receive it weekly.

title: Tim Stuetzle Leads German Hockeys Next N.H.L. Influx
description: With his strong skating and sharp stickhandling skills, Tim Stuetzle, an 18-year-old German forward, has drawn comparisons to Patrick Kane.

title: As Summer Wanes in N.Y.C., Anxiety Rises Over What Fall May Bring
description: In March and April, as ambulances raced through neighborhoods and refrigerated trucks sat humming behind hospitals overwhelmed by the pandemics dead, summer seemed a distant fantasy. Then it arrived as promised: The city unveiled in a series of phases that brought its streets back to something closer to life.

title: How TikToks Talks With Microsoft Turned Into a Soap Opera
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Microsoft began talking this summer with the popular video app TikTok and its Chinese parent company, ByteDance, no one had any intentions of pursuing a blockbuster deal.

title: From Trumps Shadow, Mike Pence Can See 2024
description: Vice President Mike Pence, the head of the federal coronavirus task force, delivered a clear message to governors about reopening schools. Help us help you, Mr. Pence told the state executives during a virtual meeting in early July, stressing that the administration wanted to see children back in the classroom.

title: Trevor Noah Thinks the G.O.P. Needs a Different Sales Pitch
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: This Zucchini Tian Is Nonna-Inspired Cooking at Restaurant Speed
description: There was always a little static while trying to bring my lo-fi home cooking into a restaurant setting, producing it at restaurant speed and volume, pace and temperature, and getting it back on the plate in such a way that would still remind you of good home cooking. In spite of its stainless-steel countertops and the crew of line cooks in clogs and aprons and scullery caps cranking out the food each night, Prune was always meant to convey the feeling that there was just some gentle older woman back there in heavy stockings and a cardigan who had fixed you a plate from the pots on the stove.

title: Changing My Name Allowed Me to Move On
description: I was 6 when I learned of my fathers death. Before then, I was blithely unaware that fathers existed, having lived only with my mother. But once I started school and saw that other families were different from mine, I went from never noticing fathers to suddenly noticing them everywhere: cheering at softball games; video-recording dance recitals; picking up a friend from school, hoisting her onto his broad shoulders, both of them smiling. I begrudged those daughters for having a male presence in their lives, for having a protector.

title: Convicted of Sex Crimes, but With No Victims
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: The Unexpected Joy of Internet Art
description: A kind of infinite scroll spills across your mobile or desktop screen: small-print black text against a white background, punctuated by the occasional red heart emoji. At first, it looks like a long Excel spreadsheet, then a bit like a war memorial.

title: Experiences With Cancer, Captured in Works of Art
description: As Covid-19 heightens the anxieties of cancer patients, online support groups step up efforts to help by means of social networking. One such group, Twist Out Cancer, sponsors an innovative program called Brushes With Cancer that matches patients with artists who create a unique piece of artwork to capture the experience of their disease.

title: Women Would Abolish Child Labor (and Other Anti-Suffrage Excuses)
description: Last week, on Aug. 18, we celebrated the 100th anniversary of the ratification of the 19th Amendment, which gave American women the constitutional right to vote. On Wednesday, we are marking the day when the amendment officially entered the Constitution. We pay little attention to what happened during that curious, chaotic week in between. Why the delay?

title: Partners in Business, Parenthood and Marriage (in Any Order)
description: Almost nothing about Kayla Picciuto and Andrew Elias relationship has been traditional or expected.

title: The Suffragists Fought to Redefine Femininity. The Debate Isnt Over.
description: When Kamala Harris stepped onto the stage in a high school gym in Delaware earlier this month, after Joseph R. Biden Jr. announced that he had chosen her as his running mate, she sought to define herself as many things  a senator, a Black woman, an Indian woman, a prosecutor.

title: I Attended Boys State, and Survived
description: It was the summer of 2018, and I was 17. My moms Volkswagen Passat shook to the riffs of Kierra Sheard as she looked for a place to park, and I shook along with it, nervously. I was about to embark on an intense weeklong social experiment.

title: Exercise May Boost Your Vaccine Response
description: If you are an athlete, you may gain greater immunity from a flu shot than people who are less active, according to two complementary and timely new studies of exercise and vaccinations. The two studies, which involved the same group of elite runners, swimmers, wrestlers, cyclists and other athletes, suggest that intense training amplifies our vaccine response, a finding with particular relevance now, as the flu season looms and scientists work to develop a Covid-19 vaccine.

title: Did Trump Overvalue His Properties? Heres What We Know About the Inquiry
description: Over the years, Donald Trump and his company have placed widely different values on the Seven Springs estate.

title: In Britain, an Idea to Reduce Racial Inequality Gains Momentum
description: Nearly two years ago, the British government seemed to be on the verge of doing something truly novel about racial and ethnic inequality. Theresa May, the prime minister at the time, had adopted a plan to root out one of the causes of differences in incomes that would create a fairer and more diverse work force, she said.

title: 7 Podcasts to Serve Shaken or Stirred
description: More than five months into the pandemic, the early lockdown novelty of homemade cocktails and virtual happy hours may be starting to wear thin. If youre seeking inspiration for your next quarantini, trying to figure out which wines to stock up on for the fall, or just feeling wistful for the atmosphere at your neighborhood watering hole, there just might be a podcast out there to quench your thirst.

title: Why Only the Republicans Are Talking About Abortion
description: Ahead of her speech at the Republican National Convention on Tuesday evening, Abby Johnson, the former Planned Parenthood clinic director turned prominent anti-abortion activist, said she hoped to deliver the most provocative, impassioned, memorable anti-abortion speech in history.

title: A Night of Crossing Lines: Four Takeaways From Tuesday at the R.N.C.
description: Adam: Jenny, I am exhausted. That was an overwhelming crush of stuff. It was like a mash-up of a reality show, a nonstop television advertisement and a convention. The stirring patriotic images, the rousing music, the heartfelt tributes and, of course, the slashing attacks. Ive never seen so much of the inside of the White House. I feel like I traveled from Washington to Israel and back again in the course of two hours. Well, I guess we did.

title: How MTV Cribs Rewired My Brain, and Maybe Yours Too
description: What would you do if you got really rich?

title: The Epic Shamelessness of the Republican Convention
description: Conventions lie. Or at least they tell extravagant fibs. Thats how they transform their nominees from mere mortals to near messiahs. Thats how they whip up the faithful and woo the agnostics.

title: California, We Cant Go On Like This
description: Across much of California in the last two weeks, many of my friends and neighbors have faced a dead-end choice: Is it safer to conduct your life outdoors and avoid the coronavirus, or should you rush inside, the better to escape the choking heat, toxic smoke and raining ash?

title: Hotels Tout Cleaning, But Guests Say, My Room Was Dirty
description: In June, Charles Kunz stayed at the Westin Atlanta Airport and found the largest cockroach Ive ever seen on his bed the next morning. The lawyer from Durham, N.C., a Titanium member of Marriotts Bonvoy loyalty program, said the insect was the size of my pinkie. I live in the South and Im no stranger to bugs.

title: Officials Warn of Catastrophic Storm Surge With Hurricane Laura
description: This briefing has ended. Click here for Hurricane Laura updates.

title: Why Does the Coronavirus Hit Men Harder? A New Clue
description: The coronavirus may infect anyone, young or old, but older men are up to twice as likely to become severely sick and to die as women of the same age.

title: I Fear That We Are Witnessing the End of American Democracy
description: The center-right political coalition in America  the Republican Party as it stands today  can be described as holding two overarching goals: First, deregulation and reductions in corporate and other tax liabilities  each clearly stated on the White House website  and second, but packing a bigger punch, the preservation of the status quo by stemming the erosion of the privileged status of white Christian America.

title: As Stanford Cuts Teams, Olympic Hopefuls All Over the U.S. Feel a Chill
description: Kyler Presho, a Stanford mens volleyball player, cant forget all the times university officials said they were in this together.

title: Should Children Go Back to School? It Depends in Part on Your Politics
description: Parents in the United States are anxious and unsure about how to keep their children safe and able to learn during the pandemic school year. But there is a large political divide in how they think about these issues, several new surveys show.

title: Whats a Palantir? The Tech Industrys Next Big I.P.O.
description: About a month before he became president, Donald J. Trump met with the leaders of the countrys top technology companies at Trump Tower in Manhattan.

title: Living In ... Holmdel, N.J.
description: With plenty of open space, the Monmouth County township is attracting city buyers  and inventory is at a record low.

title: G.O.P. Women in Arizona Could Decide an Unexpected 2020 Battle
description: Cindy McCain, the widow of the Republican senator John McCain, appeared last week in a video at the Democratic National Convention detailing her husbands unlikely friendship with Joseph R. Biden Jr. She praised the Democratic nominee for his willingness to reach across the aisle, calling it a style of legislating and leadership that you dont find much anymore.

title: Feminist Factions United and Filled the Streets for This Historic March
description: The 1970 Womens Strike for Equality was the largest womens rights demonstration since the era of suffrage  and more inclusive than anything that had been seen before. Fifty years to the day after suffragists secured the vote for American women, tens of thousands of women took to the streets of New York to commemorate this past success and to demand the unfinished business of our equality.

title: Mr. Smith Went to Washington  With Dimmers
description: I was reading Michael Smiths chronicle of designing the Obama White House, feeling serene, marinating in a luxurious world of wine-colored swatches and embossed mohair velvet and carpet border details desperately in need of tweaking.

title: Holmdel, N.J.: A Friendly Community Full of Peace and Quiet
description: Billy and Jennifer Gambardella lived on Staten Island most of their lives, so even after moving to Holmdel, N.J., three years ago, they often found themselves back in the old neighborhood. He would visit his mother and friends, or get a haircut. She was there every day for her middle-school teaching job, and frequently to get her nails done. But all of that changed when the coronavirus struck.

title: Schools Can Reopen, Germany Finds, but Expect a Roller Coaster
description: BERLIN  On the Monday after summer vacation, Dirk Kwee was as nervous as he had ever been in 31 years of teaching. For the first time since the pandemic hit, all 900 students at his Berlin school were back, bursting with excitement.

title: Republican Convention: Best and Worst Moments From Night 2
description: Welcome to Opinions commentary for Night 2 of the Republican National Convention. In this special feature, Times Opinion writers rank the evening on a scale of 1 to 10: 1 means the night was a disaster for Republicans; 10 means it could lead to a big polling bump for the Trump-Pence ticket. Heres what our columnists and contributors thought of the event, which highlighted Eric Trump, Tiffany Trump, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and Melania Trump.

title: Medics Save Lives. Let Them.
description: Six months after the coronavirus began surging across the United States, closing down cities, businesses and schools, it is still ravaging American communities.  The death toll has risen past 175,000. Hospitals are increasingly overwhelmed. So far, the federal government has abdicated responsibility, so Americans should look to one organization that has shown it can have a significant impact on saving lives: the U.S. military.

title: Trumps Legal Entanglements in N.Y.
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Almost 500 Million Children Are Cut Off From School in Pandemic, Report Says
description: This briefing has ended. Read live coronavirus updates here.

title: Nearly 80 Killed as Flash Floods Ravage City in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  When the heavy rains came overnight, setting off flash floods in northern Afghanistan, the deluge quickly turned deadly and caught many residents off guard because they were sleeping.

title: Overcoming the Fear of Making a Wrong Turn
description: As my 40th birthday approaches, Ive started doing mazes. I want to see what they can teach me. On Saturday mornings, my 7-year-old daughter, Stella, stares down a maze we are both working on that looks like small intestines.

title: 80 Tips for Remote Learning From Seasoned Educators
description: This July we hosted our first New York Times Teaching Project Summer Institute, bringing talented educators from around the country together virtually. But even as we assembled via Zoom panels, presentations and breakout sessions to create curriculum, the confusing news alerts about the 2020-21 school year just kept coming. To their immense credit, these teachers  from Los Angeles and St. Louis, Houston, Philadelphia, Miami and everywhere in between  didnt seem distracted. Instead, they rolled with the changes, continuing to come up with creative ways to reach their students, wherever and however theyd be working with them.

title: Trumps Suburban Strategy
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: What to Plant in a Hot, Dry Year? Succulents, of Course
description: The photo in a recent newsletter from Katherine Tracey, a garden designer in Massachusetts, filled me with longing, and not a small amount of regret. Why didnt I think to fill my pots with succulents as she did  plants like Echeveria, Senecio, Sempervivum and even certain Sedum that deliver a long show with relatively little care?

title: The New Power Dressing
The 3 Scariest Chemicals to Watch Out For in Your Home
description: I was on vacation so I asked Erik Vance, one of NYT Parentings staff editors, to take the wheel of the newsletter. This week, hes highlighting a series by the science writer Liza Gross about the worst chemicals for your family, and how to avoid them.

title: The Debate Over Riots
description: If youre an intense reader of the news, you may already know the story of David Shors firing.

title: Behind the scenes of TikToks talks with Microsoft.
description: How did the talks between Microsoft and ByteDance, the parent company of TikTok, turn into a soap opera? Mike Isaac and Andrew Ross Sorkin spoke with more than a dozen people to understand what happened as the Trump administration began scrutinizing popular app:

title: Trumps unemployment supplement: Long waits and less money for fewer people.
description: President Trumps plan to replace the $600-a-week emergency federal unemployment supplement originally called for unemployed workers to receive $400 each week, with $100 to be supplied by the states. Heres what we know now about the supplement.

title: The G.O.P. Wishes Away the Virus
description: Hi. Welcome to a convention recap edition of On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics.

title: Melania Trump Came Dressed for Battle. But Which One?
description: On the second night of the Republican National Convention, Melania Trump came dressed for battle.

title: How to Watch the Republican Convention
description: Vice President Mike Pence will be the star of the third night of the Republican National Convention, which will also include speeches from several prominent members of Congress.

title: Charlie Parker at 100: What to Read, Watch and Dig
description: Charlie Parkers brief swing through this world kicked off a century ago on Saturday with his birth in Kansas City, Kan. Eleven years later, he would take up the saxophone. A couple of years after that, inspired by the hot bands tearing up K.C. in the 30s, the man who was later known as Bird dedicated himself to his instrument, the alto, woodshedding for 11 to 15 hours a day, he would later say.

title: A Cozy Cottage on an Island Northeast of Stockholm
description: AMONG THE MANY fashion boutiques that Christian and Ruxandra Halleroed have designed is a series of nine stores for the Swedish clothing brand Acne Studios, some of which feel like industrial-size meat lockers, with soaring monolithic brushed stainless-steel walls and floors of mottled poured concrete, terrazzo or concrete-print carpet. The effect is not unfeeling but bracing, in the vein of an old-fashioned Austrian spa: The severe gray backdrop makes the clothes, which often come in pleasantly murky colors, look more vibrant by comparison. This rigorously modern approach to design  often characterized by unbroken expanses of single materials (a wall of burled elm in one store, diamond-embossed aluminum in another) combined with inviting planes of color (a peony-pink wall-to-wall carpet, for example, or a standing shelving unit in copper sulfate blue)  has made Halleroed, the design studio that Christian, 46, founded in Stockholm in 1998, and which Ruxandra, 39, joined in 2015, sought after by fashion brands, particularly young Scandinavian labels whose gameness for experimentation resonates with the firms own.

title: R.N.C. Revives a Trump Persona: Reality-TV Prize Giver
description: Prime-time TV viewers first got to know Donald J. Trump delivering his catchphrase, Youre fired, in the boardroom of The Apprentice. But firing wasnt all that he did on that show. He also gave away prizes: helicopter rides, trips to Mar-a-Lago and in each seasons finale, a job. Later, in the Celebrity Apprentice years, hed grant donations to the winners chosen charities.

title: Palantir, Ant and the Tech Listing Boom
description: Want this delivered to your inbox each day? Sign up here.

title: California Fires: Want to Control Blazes? Start More, Experts Say
description: Good morning.

title: The Lesson Were Learning From TikTok? Its All About Our Data
description: Is TikTok, the Chinese-owned social network that is used mostly by teenagers to post dance videos, a national security threat?

title: Is New Yorks Arts Diversity Plan Working? Its Hard to Tell
description: It was born of high hopes: a program for cultural institutions that receive New York City funding and operate on New York City land.

title: What You Get for $780,000
description: An 1810 Federal-style house near the harbor in Bristol, R.I.; a midcentury-modern home in Alexandria, Va.; and a 1906 Tudor Revival in Davenport, Iowa.

title: $780,000 Homes in Rhode Island, Virginia and Iowa
description: Russell Warren, who came to Bristol in 1800 and became one of the leading architects in southeastern New England, designed this shingled house for his own use. According to the listing agent, more than $275,000 has been spent in the last 15 years to upgrade it, while respecting its historical integrity. The front porch was recently replaced; the roof, with its copper gutters, is a decade old. The original interior woodwork and hardware remain, as do most of the early six-over-six windows.

title: Historic Charm in the Hills of Poland
description: This 4,500-square-foot, 19th-century house in the hills of southeast Poland is on the market for $523,000.

title: House Hunting in Poland: A 19th-Century Cottage for $523,000
description: This two-bedroom, two-bath house is in the village of Kwiatonowice, in the mountainous southeastern Malopolska province of Poland, about 70 miles east of the provincial capital of Krakow.

title: The 2021 World Economic Forum summit will be rescheduled, organizers say.
description: The World Economic Forum is pushing back its annual summit in Davos, Switzerland, from January to early next summer, it announced on Wednesday.

title: One Meeting in Boston Seeded Tens of Thousands of Infections, Study Finds
description: On Feb. 26, 175 executives at the biotech company Biogen gathered at a Boston hotel for the first night of a conference. At the time, the coronavirus seemed a faraway problem, limited mostly to China.

title: A Cartier Necklace With Opals That Shine Like River Stones
description: The panther has been Cartiers leitmotif for more than a century. The first time the Paris-based jewelry company, founded in 1847, alluded to the graceful jungle cat was in 1914, when the house created a womens platinum wristwatch with a case that resembled an abstracted version of the elegant animals spots, in onyx and diamonds. In the decades that followed, the house, led by creative director Jeanne Toussaint, interpreted the panther in increasingly figurative ways, culminating in the three-dimensional brooches and bracelet made for the Duchess of Windsor in the late 1940s and 50s, in which the animals emerald or diamond eyes seemed to glow.

title: 5 Art Accounts to Follow on Instagram Now
description: Months into the pandemic, barreling toward the presidential election, its difficult to know what we should be viewing or even trusting. The following Instagram accounts offer what I consider credible information in a world full of upheaval and unrest. What to read? What to question? What to believe? Here are some thoughts.

title: Itzhak Perlman, Violin Legend, Still Proves the Critics Wrong
description: Itzhak Perlman is a superstar in classical music. And not just there: No other violinist enjoys his level of recognition among people who dont even go to traditional concerts.

title: A Beginners Guide to the Golden Age of Live Theater on TV
description: One of my earliest memories is of a man and woman arguing. I had just turned 5 years old. These angry grown-ups, who wore clothes from another time, were not my parents. Yet the image now feels as primal as if they were.

title: You Cant Escape Lice, Even 6,500 Feet Below the Ocean
description: Darling, its better under the sea, unless youre an insect. You might find some bugs skimming the surface of a pond or even creating their own scuba bubble to dive beneath the surface of inland lakes. But insects are virtually absent from the open ocean.

title: Republican convention speakers tried to recast Trump as an inclusive leader.
description: On Tuesday night, Republicans cast the president as the countrys greatest protector  not only from mobs of protesters but also of free speech, economic opportunity and even faith itself. And they wanted viewers to know that he was not anti-immigrant or sexist.

title: U.S. Penalizes 24 Chinese Companies Over Role in South China Sea
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration on Wednesday added 24 Chinese companies to a government list that bans them from buying American products, citing their role in helping the Chinese military construct artificial islands in the disputed South China Sea.

title: Heres how to watch Night 3 of the Republican convention, and whos speaking.
description: Vice President Mike Pence will headline the third night of the Republican National Convention on Wednesday, which will also include speeches from several prominent members of Congress and the outgoing White House adviser Kellyanne Conway.

title: Night 1 of the R.N.C. was filled with foreboding. Night 2 was about softening the portrait of Trump.
description: In an abrupt swerve from the dire tone of the Republican National Conventions first night, Tuesday featured President Trump and the various speakers  including three of his family members  painting his presidency as one of inclusion, mercy and harmony, in a grab bag night that seemed aimed at female and minority voters.

title: Trump keeps bending and breaking presidential norms. It will be easier for his successors to do the same.
description: Live (and taped) from Washington, it was Tuesday Night.

title: Peaceful Marches and Armored Vehicles: Scenes From Kenosha Protests
description: Unrest in Kenosha, Wis., continued after the police shooting of Jacob Blake, a Black resident. Peaceful demonstrations earlier in the day gave way to chaos as law enforcement faced off with protesters.

title: Republican women in Arizona could play a pivotal role in an unusual battleground.
description: Cindy McCain, the widow of the Republican senator John McCain, appeared last week in a video at the Democratic National Convention detailing her husbands unlikely friendship with Joseph R. Biden Jr. She praised Mr. Biden, the Democratic nominee, for his willingness to reach across the aisle, calling it a style of legislating and leadership that you dont find much anymore.

title: Recipes That Bring Joy
description: Hello, NYT cooks! Im taking over this newsletter from Tejal Rao, and somehow we will get through the last gasp of summer together. (Sam Sifton will just before Labor Day.)

title: 11 Female Voices, From Age 13 to 110, on Why the Vote Matters
Naturalization ceremony provides a moment of cognitive dissonance with Trumps immigration stance.
description: President Trump sought Tuesday to wrap himself in pro-immigrant sentiment  even though his administration has waged a yearslong assault on the nations immigration system  by presiding over a naturalization ceremony at the White House during the second night of the Republican National Convention.

title: A Woman May Have Been Cured of H.I.V. Without Medical Treatment
description: A woman who was infected with H.I.V. in 1992 may be the first person cured of the virus without a risky bone-marrow transplant or even medications, researchers reported on Wednesday.

title: Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival Finds First Permanent Home
description: The tent is moving. The preshow picnics and riverside views are staying.

title: In U.F.C., Retirement Threats Are the Fighters New Leverage
description: After dominating the light-heavyweight division for 10 years, Jon Jones is moving up to heavyweight. That is, if he doesnt retire from the Ultimate Fighting Championship first.

title: Bare Breasts on French Beaches? You Can, Despite Police Warnings
description: The scene was anodyne: women were sunbathing on a beach in southwestern France last week, bare breasted.

title: Bernard Fils-Aim, Haitian Activist and Cellphone Mogul, Dies at 67
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: M.T.A. Warns of Doomsday Subway Cuts Without $12 Billion in Federal Aid
description: Facing a staggering financial crisis and a stalemate in Washington, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority threatened on Wednesday to adopt a doomsday plan if it did not receive as much as $12 billion in federal aid, including slashing subway and bus service in New York City by 40 percent.

title: New Director Sees Berlins Jewish Museum as a Place for Debate
description: BERLIN  On her first day as the director of the Jewish Museum Berlin, Hetty Berg sat alone in her third-floor office, looked into a camera and introduced herself to her new team of around 160 people, most of them stuck at home because of the coronavirus lockdown.

title: White House chief of staff: Nobody outside of the Beltway really cares about possible Hatch Act violations.
description: After the second day of a Republican National Convention whose proceedings trampled over long-established lines between governing and campaigning, Mark Meadows, the White House chief of staff, scoffed at concerns that President Trump and other top officials were abusing federal offices and property for political gain.

title: Biden is selling hand sanitizer with his Covid-19 plan printed on it.
description: Sometimes campaign stores are not just about selling merchandise. Sometimes they are about making political statements.

title: How Much Coffee Should You Drink During Pregnancy? Maybe None at All
description: The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists recommends limiting caffeine consumption during pregnancy to 200 milligrams a day, or roughly 12 ounces of coffee, but a new review of studies suggests that no caffeine at all may be safer.

title: Yet Another Use for Your Sheet Pan: Sugar Cookies
description: Even during this socially restrained pandemic, there are still likely to be times when youll want to bake an enormous batch of cookies quickly  whether its for sharing with others, or for your own future bingeing. Sheet-pan sugar cookies are here for you.

title: Stephanie Bice won a G.O.P. runoff to challenge the only Democrat in Oklahomas congressional delegation.
description: Stephanie Bice, an Oklahoma state legislator, won the Republican primary on Tuesday to challenge Representative Kendra Horn, the lone Democrat in the Oklahoma delegation.

title: Dark Portrait of a Childhood Wins International Booker Prize
description: LONDON  The Discomfort of Evening, a story of childhood grief that reviewers have called both disturbing and exceptional, was named on Wednesday as the winner of the International Booker Prize, the prestigious award for fiction translated into English.

title: President Trump used the White House as a game show set, our TV critic writes.
description: President Trump built a television persona around his catchphrase, Youre fired, on The Apprentice. But he also gave away prizes and presented himself as a benefactor  a role that he has revived during the Republican National Convention, The Timess chief television critic, James Poniewozik, noted. He wrote:

title: What Trumps Sister Said About Him
description: To the Editor:

title: Manchester United Star Convicted of Assault in Greece, but Questions Linger
description: A star athlete. An $82,000 restaurant bill before a boozy encounter on a sun-soaked island. A fight, arrests and  less than a week later  a conviction. But no conclusion.

title: Ancestry Promises Holocaust Records Will Be Free
description: Steven Spielbergs U.S.C. Shoah Foundation has partnered with the genealogy giant Ancestry to digitize about 50,000 records, adding to a free searchable database in Ancestrys Holocaust archive.

title: Border Officials Weighed Deploying Migrant Heat Ray Ahead of Midterms
description: WASHINGTON  Fifteen days before the 2018 midterm elections, as President Trump sought to motivate Republicans with dark warnings about caravans heading to the U.S. border, he gathered his homeland security secretary and White House staff to deliver a message: extreme action was needed to stop the migrants.

title: She Sought Justice on TikTok. Now Her Father Is Charged With Homicide.
description: Sarah Turney was 12 years old when her sister, Alissa Turney, 17, vanished in 2001.

title: In the Second Volume of Hitler, How a Dictator Invited His Own Downfall
description: The impulsiveness and grandiosity, the bullying and vulgarity, were obvious from the beginning; if anything, they accounted for Adolf Hitlers anti-establishment appeal. For Germanys unpopular conservative elites, Hitlers energy and theatrics made him an enticing partner when they appointed him chancellor on Jan. 30, 1933.

title: Critiques of the Republican Convention
description: To the Editor:

title: Asian-Americans and the Bias Suit Against Yale
description: To the Editor:

title: Schools Briefing: Parents in New York City Are Stressed
description: After lying awake most of the night, Michelle Goldberg, a Times Opinion columnist, gave up on sleep and started writing about the anxiety and despair of being a New York City parent with school-age children.

title: New York Philharmonic Restarts the Music With a Pickup Truck
description: The New York Philharmonic is best known for grand, formal performances in its Lincoln Center home. But with theaters and concert halls closed by the coronavirus pandemic at least until the end of the year, the orchestra is trying out a decidedly more casual, outdoor and mobile space, with a DIY, yee-haw vibe.

title: How Racist Urban Planning Left Some Neighborhoods to Swelter
description: Welcome to the Climate Fwd: newsletter. The New York Times climate team emails readers once a week with stories and insights about climate change. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.

title: Rising Phoenix Review: Carrying the Paralympic Torch
description: The documentary Rising Phoenix opens with triumphant imagery: stone statues of Paralympians in a dim room, illuminated by beams of light. In voice-over, a competitor compares his fellow athletes to Marvels Avengers; like the characters, they excelled in the face of adversity. This image, of Paralympians as reborn superheroes, is central to the films facile portrait of the Paralympic Games. Its tribute could double as a commercial for the event  or, in blander moments, an ad for activewear.

title: Luka Doncic Had an Off Night. Hes Still Special.
description: Want more basketball in your inbox? Sign up for Marc Steins weekly N.B.A. newsletter here.

title: Flash Floods Rip Through Afghan City
description: Flooding from heavy rains in Charikar, Afghanistan, killed nearly 80 people, according to an official, and destroyed dozens of homes.

title: Theater to Stream: A World of Fringe and More Apples
description: Theater is a physical art form, but it is becoming increasingly obvious that its expanded online presence is here to stay, especially as the web smooths out issues of collaboration and access, both financial and physical.

title: What Jerry Falwell Jr. Taught Me at Liberty University
description: When I was a student at Liberty University, from 2012 to 2016, I had to take two semesters of a Christian worldview class. It consisted essentially of bullet-point lists of ethical issues, with quizzes to make sure we knew the right answers: How did we feel about abortion? What about gay marriage? We were required to take two Bible classes and two theology classes, which included plenty of information about sexual ethics and basic Christian beliefs about caring for the poor and marginalized.

title: Sweden Raises Alarm over Russian Military Exercises
description: STOCKHOLM  Holiday makers in Sweden heading out Tuesday to enjoy summer weather on Gotland, a scenic island in the Baltic Sea, were jolted when armored personnel carriers and other military vehicles boarded their tourist ferry, which was then escorted by Swedish fighter jets and a warship.

title: Masks and social distancing are mostly absent from Republican convention events.
description: Halfway through the Republican convention, there have been some notable omissions: a traditional party platform, any mention of impeachment and a meaningful reckoning with the number of Americans who have died from the coronavirus.

title: N.C. State at Virginia Tech Is Postponed Because of a Coronavirus Cluster
description: College football on Wednesday got a sobering glimpse of what could become routine this season: a game rescheduled because of coronavirus cases inside an athletic program.

title: Midway through the Republican convention, speakers have downplayed the coronavirus.
description: With the Republican National Convention at the midway point, the biggest contrast with the Democrats has been in how little attention the Republicans have given to the coronavirus pandemic that has upended life across America and led to over 178,000 deaths.

title: BOA Steakhouse Is Where Influencers Go to See and Be Seen
description: We spend a lot of our days chatting with each other about things we see online, trying to make sense of it all. This week in the Styles newsletter, Wait , our reporter Taylor Lorenz talked to the manager of BOA Steakhouse, the Los Angeles restaurant that has attracted Gen Z influencers and their fans. Sign up here to get Wait in your inbox.

title: After Three Years of Attacking L.G.B.T.Q. Rights, Trump Suddenly Tries Outreach
description: [Follow our daily updates on the latest presidential election polls.]

title: Two Black-Led Banks Merge to Form a $1 Billion Lender
description: A merger announced Wednesday will create the nations largest Black-controlled bank and the first with assets of more than $1 billion.

title: Flood and Sacrifice: How an Old Convent Could Help Save New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS  Fifteen years ago, Hurricane Katrina flooded a convent in the heart of New Orleans, scattering its nuns. Now the Sisters of St. Joseph are using the ruins of their motherhouse to create one of the countrys largest urban wetlands. It will absorb millions of gallons of runoff during storms and will, the nuns hope, help save their city.

title: Im an Activist in Russia. I Cant Believe What My Life Has Become.
description: By now, you have probably seen the news that Aleksei Navalny, another leading critic of Russias president, Vladimir Putin, appears to have been poisoned. It must seem so horrible, but also, perhaps like the kind of thing that does happen over there, in Russia, in Belarus, in authoritarian states.

title: How Mark Duplass and Bradley Whitford Swapped Bodies
description: The 72nd Primetime Emmy Awards will be given out on Sept. 20, so were talking to pairs of nominated actors as we look ahead to the ceremony. (Whatever it ends up being.) For a full list of Emmy nominees and other coverage of TVs top awards, visit nytimes.com/Emmys.

title: Natural History Museum Union Files Complaint Over Coronavirus App
description: New York Citys largest municipal union on Tuesday filed an unfair labor practice complaint against the American Museum of Natural History over the institutions plan to require employees to record possible coronavirus symptoms on an app. The head of the union called it overly intrusive.

title: Live Comedy Is Back in New York! But Outdoors. Is This a Good Thing?
description: On a beautiful Thursday evening in Prospect Park, Ariel Elias, a sly young comic from Kentucky, walked down a hill, looked at a few dozen socially distanced audience members sitting near a family flying a kite, and said: Thank you for being here  and shame on you.

title: A Conversation About Making Cities More Equitable
The Feds Evolution Is Coming to a Computer Screen Near You
description: WASHINGTON  For more than a year, the Federal Reserve has wrestled with how to achieve its twin goals  maximum employment and stable inflation  in an era of tepid price increases and very low interest rates.

title: Ted Cruz Didnt Get a Convention Invite. He Still Has Plenty to Say.
description: [Follow our daily updates on the latest presidential election polls.]

title: Family of Fort Hood Soldier Found Dead Demands Congress Investigate
description: The family of a Fort Hood soldier found hanging from a tree demanded that Congress investigate the base on Wednesday, saying he had accused a superior of sexual assault before he went missing almost 10 days ago.

title: A Beautiful, Urgent Novel of the Palestinian Struggle
description: AGAINST THE LOVELESS WORLD By Susan Abulhawa

title: The Timeless Pleasure of Playing Games
description: Welcome. One of the conversations I find myself having frequently with loved ones in recent months is about how we experience time passing. Is it plodding, each month seeming, since March, to contain twice as many days? Or is it careening by, a windblown mess of calendar pages left in its dust?

title: Yale Law Professor Is Suspended After Sexual Harassment Inquiry
description: Jed Rubenfeld, a prominent professor at Yale Law School, was widely known as someone who could jump-start students careers by helping them secure coveted clerkships with federal judges.

title: Hawaii Primary Election Results: First Congressional District
Live: Hawaii Primary Election Results 2020
Hawaii Primary Election Results: Second Congressional District
Pence prepares for a rare moment in the spotlight.
description: As Vice President Mike Pence prepares to deliver his speech at the third night of the Republican convention this evening, he has one eye on getting his boss re-elected and the other on 2024.

title: I Dont Know If My Relationship Will Survive the Pandemic
description: I cant take it anymore, I told my partner of seven years and the father of my two children. Maybe we should start looking for separate places.

title: U.S. Flood Strategy Shifts to Unavoidable Relocation of Entire Neighborhoods
description: This weeks one-two punch of Hurricane Laura and Tropical Storm Marco may be extraordinary, but the storms are just two of nine to strike Texas and Louisiana since 2017 alone, helping to drive a major federal change in how the nation handles floods.

title: TV ratings rise on G.O.P.s second night.
description: Television audiences rose for the second night of the Republican National Convention, with the first lady, Melania Trump, attracting more viewers than Mondays keynote speaker, Senator Tim Scott of South Carolina. About 19.4 million people watched live on Tuesday from 10 to 11:15 p.m., compared to roughly 17 million on Monday night.

title: After rolling back transgender protections, the Trump campaign is courting the L.G.B.T.Q. vote.
description: The month of June was filled with big moments for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people. President Trump was almost entirely silent through it all.

title: Angela Buxton, Half of an Outcast Duo in Tennis History, Dies at 85
description: They were both outsiders in the starched white world of elite 1950s tennis, superb players but excluded from tournaments and clubs and shunned on the circuit because of their heritage. Angela Buxton, a white, Jewish Englishwoman, was a granddaughter of Russian Jews who had fled the pogroms in the early 1900s; Althea Gibson, a Black American, was born in a sharecroppers shack in South Carolina and grew up in Harlem.

title: Kenosha Police Department Steps Back From Blake Investigation
description: The Wisconsin Division of Criminal Investigation will lead the inquiry into the shooting of Jacob Blake as part of a standard process by the state, Kenoshas police chief said.

title: U.S. Troops Injured in Syria After Collision With Russian Vehicles
description: WASHINGTON  A small number of U.S. troops were injured this week during a skirmish with Russian forces in northeastern Syria, American officials said on Wednesday, underscoring the risk of simmering tensions between the two rival powers in a hotly contested part of the country.

title: What Is the Hatch Act? Is Trump Violating It at the R.N.C.?
description: [Follow our daily updates on the latest presidential election polls.]

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: As Beijing has tightened its grip to end dissent in the territory, law enforcement has faced criticism.

title: Led by N.B.A., Boycotts Disrupt Pro Sports in Wake of Blake Shooting
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla.  Athletes from the N.B.A., W.N.B.A., Major League Baseball and Major League Soccer took their boldest stand yet against systemic racism and police brutality, boycotting games on Wednesday in response to the police shooting of a Black man in Kenosha, Wis. The moves dramatically escalated a season of athletes demonstrating for social justice as some expressed doubts about continuing to play amid widespread social unrest.

title: Suspect in Sarah Lawrence Cult Case Is Accused of Witness Tampering
description: Prosecutors say Lawrence V. Ray was a Svengali-like figure who moved into his daughters dormitory at Sarah Lawrence College and recruited some of her classmates into a bizarre, cultlike group.

title: Biden condemns racism and says that burning down communities is not protest.
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Wednesday condemned the needless violence that has unfolded in Kenosha, Wis., since the police shooting of a Black man, as he also expressed his solidarity with peaceful protesters and denounced systemic racism.

title: A Rebuilt Pitcher Puts Together the Seasons First No-Hitter
description: The grim line of numbers is frozen forever, a monument to the depths of professional despair for Lucas Giolito of the Chicago White Sox. In 2018, he had a 6.13 earned run average with 90 walks. It is very hard to be that bad and stay in the majors.

title: What to Watch for at R.N.C.: Two of Trumps Most Faithful Allies Will Headline
description: The third night of the Republican National Convention will build on the themes laid out earlier this week, casting President Trump as the barrier to a changing America and his re-election as a moral imperative.

title: Anthony Martignetti (Anthony!), Who Raced Home for Spaghetti, Dies at 63
description: Anthony Martignetti, who found television immortality as a 12-year-old Italian immigrant when he sprinted through Bostons North End in an enduring television commercial for Prince spaghetti, playing a boy who is beckoned by his mothers cry, Anthony! Anthony!, died on Sunday at his home in West Roxbury, Mass. He was 63.

title: 2020 Can Go to Hell: The Story Behind the Viral Fire Photo That Said It All
description: LAKE BERRYESSA, Calif.  In the sprawling destruction of Californias wildfires, one photo became an instant icon for 2020s miseries: On a hillside roaring with flames stood a sign that asked visitors to a senior center to wear masks, wash their hands and be safe. Come Join Us, it beckoned creepily.

title: E.U. Trade Chief Quits, a Casualty of Dinner That Flouted Virus Rules
description: BRUSSELS  Phil Hogan, the influential trade commissioner for the European Union, resigned Wednesday night over breaches to coronavirus guidelines during a recent dinner with lawmakers and other public figures in his native Ireland.

title: Iran to Allow U.N. Inspections of Previously Blocked Nuclear Sites
description: WASHINGTON  Iran has agreed to let United Nations inspectors into two previously blocked nuclear sites, officials said on Wednesday, reversing itself during an international feud over its nuclear program that has divided world powers and increasingly isolated the United States.

title: Mike Pence, Hurricane Laura, Kenosha: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Get Duked! Review: The Kids Are All Fight (and Jokes)
description: In the British comedy Get Duked!, four misfit adolescents come face to face with a familiar existential threat: other people. A three-minute cat-and-mouse cartoon optimistically stretched to feature length, the movie is loud, busy and cheerfully glib, though at one point  after the weapons and politics have been brandished  it takes a brief turn to sincerity. This doesnt do much other than announce that it has more in mind than clichs and jokes about the lysergic dividends of rabbit scat.

title: A Garden Designed to Run Wild
description: In To the Small Celandine (1815), William Wordsworth marvels at the itinerant nature of the flowering plant: Careless of thy neighbourhood, / Thou dost show thy pleasant face / On the moor, and in the wood. The ode is one of three the poet wrote to his favorite flower  commonly known as the lesser celandine or fig buttercup and recognizable for its glossy, egg-yolk-yellow blooms  which is also a persistent weed. This fact, that what some see as a flicker of natural brilliance is to others a nuisance to be removed, puts the lesser celandine, along with many other wildflowers, in a precarious position. And indeed, so many gardeners come down on the side of nuisance that to cultivate wildflowers purposely, to allow them to be the focus of ones labors, even, is something of a rebellious act.

title: After New Harassment Claims, Snyder Vows More Oversight of Washington N.F.L. Team
description: Two dozen women described experiencing bullying, harassment and fear during their time working for the Washington N.F.L. team, according to a report published Wednesday by The Washington Post. The women described an office culture where managers were unwilling or unable to hold front office executives accountable for abusive behavior.

title: Intelligence Officials See No Foreign Effort to Undermine Mail-In Voting
description: WASHINGTON  Mail-in voting for the November presidential election is safe from foreign intervention, intelligence and election security officials said on Wednesday, saying that standard security measures and decentralization make the United States election system extremely difficult for a foreign power to penetrate and change the results.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: In New York, relief over the retreat of the coronavirus is giving way to intense anxiety, as residents brace for a possible resurgence in the fall. Without a vaccine, worries abound with the return of school, office life and more time spent indoors.

title: We Did the Exact Right Thing, Says Our Glorious Leader
description: What a relief!

title: Impeachment, once seen as the battle of a generation, has vanished from the political landscape.
description: In all the hours and hours of speeches at last weeks Democratic National Convention and the first two nights of the Republican National Convention, one word was almost entirely missing: impeachment.

title: After 3 Deaths, Revel Resumes N.Y.C. Moped Service With Stricter Rules
description: Immediate suspension for riding in the wrong direction down a one-way street. A 21-question test on which a rider must achieve a perfect score, twice. Photographic evidence of wearing a helmet.

title: More of Your Coronavirus Testing Questions, Answered
description: The world of coronavirus testing is complicated and confusing. There are lab tests and home tests, spit tests, swab tests and blood tests. But there are still, somehow, not enough tests. On Monday, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention revised guidelines for who should get tested. But those revisions did little to resolve the thorny questions many people are grappling with.

title: White House Dismisses Questions of Whether Convention Events Broke Anti-Corruption Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration pushed back on Wednesday against widespread criticism that its staging and filming of events at the White House used as programming for the Republican convention was illegal  dismissing arguments that it had violated the Hatch Act, a law intended to prevent the use of public power for private political gain.

title: Justice Dept. Executes Native American Man Convicted of Murder
description: WASHINGTON The Justice Department executed the only Native American man on federal death row Wednesday, against the wishes of Navajo leaders and hundreds of Native American citizens who called for President Trump to spare his life.

title: Brother of Impeachment Witness Says His Firing Was a Whistle-Blower Reprisal
description: Lt. Col. Yevgeny Vindman, an Army officer dismissed from the White House earlier this year, filed a whistle-blower complaint last week claiming that he was improperly fired in retaliation for both his role in the impeachment of President Trump and lodging previously undisclosed allegations of ethical and legal wrongdoing against Robert C. OBrien, the national security adviser.

title: Top U.S. Officials Told C.D.C. to Soften Coronavirus Testing Guidelines
description: WASHINGTON  Trump administration officials on Wednesday defended a new recommendation that people without Covid-19 symptoms abstain from testing, even as scientists warned that the policy could hobble an already weak federal response as schools reopen and a potential autumn wave looms.

title: Three Charged With Leaking Movies as Part of Global Piracy Ring
description: Three men are facing federal charges of participating in an international piracy ring that distributed popular movies and television shows online before their release dates, prosecutors announced Wednesday.

title: Trump Takes Night Off From Anti-Immigrant Talk to Swear In U.S. Citizens
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump moved within weeks of taking office to prohibit immigrants from Sudan from entering the United States, citing terrorism threats and including it in his travel ban on some predominantly Muslim countries  restrictions that remain partly in place today.

title: The Harsh Reality Behind Trumps Reality Show
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Giovanni Russonello, typically the morning newsletter writer, covering the evening shift during the conventions.

title: How Trumps Convention Has Become a Crucial Play for the Suburbs
description: It is one of President Trumps clearest paths to re-election: winning back the suburbs in a handful of swing states that drifted from the Republican Party in the 2018 midterms. And that imperative has been vividly apparent each night of the partys national convention, with speakers and videos that are trying to recast Mr. Trumps divisive record, which had hurt the G.O.P. two years ago.

title: President Trump wants his rival to take a drug test. Again.
description: President Trump took another page from his wildly unorthodox 2016 campaign playbook Wednesday and called for taking a pre-debate drug test with his Democratic opponent.

title: Three Trump Supporters Have a New Target: Germany
description: There is something profoundly skewed in Americas foreign relations when senators threaten crushing legal and economic sanctions against a port city of a close European ally.

title: Full Analysis of the Republican National Convention, Night 3
description: On the third night of the Republican National Convention, speakers included Vice President Mike Pence, Karen Pence and Kellyanne Conway. Our correspondents followed every speaker and provided live analysis and insights.

title: Dont Be Dense, Beware Mike Pence
description: Its possible you failed to notice, but the Republican convention has a theme for each night. The list sounds a little like a Lord-of-the-Rings theme park: Land of Promise, Land of Opportunity, Land of Heroes and Land of Greatness.

title: R.N.C. Rewrites Trumps Racism  and Americas
description: So far the Republican National Convention isnt so much presenting a record of America and an administration as it is inventing one.

title: Sailor Questioned in Suspected Arson Aboard Navy Warship
description: WASHINGTON  Federal investigators have questioned a sailor for suspected arson in the fire that engulfed the warship Bonhomme Richard in July, according to a senior Navy official.

title: Justice Department to Investigate Jacob Blake Shooting
description: [Heres what we know about the Jacob Blake shooting in Kenosha, Wisconsin.]

title: DNA Evidence Exonerates Man in 1983 Rape and Killing, Prosecutors Say
description: Robert DuBoise, 55, has spent two-thirds of his life behind bars for the 1983 rape and killing of a woman in Tampa, Fla. He has always maintained his innocence, but any hope of reversing his conviction seemed to evaporate in 1990 when the evidence from his trial was destroyed as part of a routine procedure.

title: How Chaos in Kenosha Is Already Swaying Some Voters in Wisconsin
description: John Geraghty, a 41-year-old worker in a tractor factory, has barely paid attention to the presidential race or the conventions. Every day he focuses on survival: getting his son to sports practice, working at his job where he now wears a mask, and getting home to sleep, only to start over again the next day.

title: Many Fear the Worst as Forecasters Issue Dire Warnings for Hurricane Laura
description: LAFAYETTE, La.  More than 500,000 residents in Louisiana and Texas were urged to flee their homes on Wednesday as Hurricane Laura roared toward the Gulf Coast, fueling grave warnings that the storm would deliver a calamitous assault with powerful winds and a storm surge that meteorologists declared unsurvivable.

title: The Bryan Brothers Retire as They Played: Together
description: On opposite coasts but still on the same wavelength, the identical twins Bob and Mike Bryan, the most successful mens doubles team in tennis history, are retiring at age 42, effective immediately.

title: Kayleigh McEnany Shares Mastectomy Story
description: The White House press secretary shared her story about her battle with breast cancer and compared her hard decision about having a preventive mastectomy to the easy decision to support President Trump.

title: Kellyanne Conway Praises Trumps Relationships With Women
description: Kellyanne Conway, who will be departing the Trump administration at the end of August, shared anecdotes about President Trump treating women as equals in her remarks to the Republican National Convention.

title: The Pences Are a Military Family, Second Lady Says
description: Karen Pence gave a largely apolitical speech to the Republican National Convention, focusing on her work with military families.

title: Windbag (No, Not You Personally)
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  There is a meme going around social media right now that says  Im paraphrasing a bit  This goes out to all the kids who had report cards growing up that read, Talks too much.

title: We Are a Country of Heroes, Dan Crenshaw Says
description: Representative Dan Crenshaw of Texas drew on his experience in Afghanistan as a Navy SEAL in a speech on American heroism to the Republican National Convention.

title: New Zealand Gives Christchurch Killer a Record Sentence
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Brenton Tarrant doctored triggers to make his weapons fire faster and be more lethal. He used a strobe light to disorient his victims. And after murdering 51 Muslims during Friday Prayer at two mosques in Christchurch, New Zealand, last year, he told the police he wished he had killed even more.

title: With Wisconsin Unrest as Backdrop, Republicans Intensify Law-and-Order Message
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans used the third night of their convention on Wednesday to amplify warnings of violence and lawlessness under Democratic leadership, trying to capitalize on the worsening unrest in Wisconsin to reclaim moderate voters who might be reluctant to hand President Trump a second term.

title: Correction: Aug. 27, 2020
description: An article on Wednesday about the James Beard Foundations decision to put its awards on hiatus misstated the category in which Blake Spalding and Jen Castle of Hells Backbone Grill & Farm, in Boulder, Utah, were nominated this year. It was Best Chef Mountain, not Best Chef Southwest.

title: Quotation of the Day: Flood-Prone Communities Retreat to Drier Land
description: Thats family land. But I dont miss all the water. I dont miss having to evacuate.

title: Lara Trump Lauds Presidents Record on Advancing Women
description: President Trumps daughter-in-law was one of many female speakers for the convention who credited him, using her own experience as an example. He knew I was capable, even if I didnt, she said.

title: Minneapolis Homicide Suspects Suicide Spurs More Protests, Police Say
description: A Black man who was wanted in a homicide fatally shot himself as the police closed in on a downtown Minneapolis street on Wednesday evening, prompting a fresh round of protests and looting, the authorities said, three months after the killing of George Floyd in the city set off global demonstrations against police violence.

title: Christchurch, Hurricane Laura, Wisconsin Protests: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Full Transcript: Mike Pences R.N.C. Speech
description: Vice President Mike Pence on Wednesday made a case that President Trump is all that is standing in the way of the United States devolving not only into anarchy but also into a state that cancels the countrys essential nature.

title: Mike Pence Accepts Nomination and Attacks Joe Biden
description: In making his case for another Trump term, the vice president spoke of President Trumps character when the cameras are off.

title: Speakers Praise Trump on Gender: For Decades He Has Elevated Women
description: Women making a case for how well President Trump treats women was a recurring theme of the third night of the Republican National Convention.

title: Tracking the Suspect in the Fatal Kenosha Shootings
description: A teenager who walked among protesters in Kenosha, Wis., carrying a military-style semi-automatic rifle was arrested and faces a charge of first-degree intentional homicide in connection with shootings that left two people dead on Tuesday night.

title: A Next Generation of Republicans: Young People Have Stepped Up
description: Several younger speakers who could represent the future of the Republican Party had prominent speaking slots on the third night of the convention.

title: TikTok Chief Executive Kevin Mayer Resigns
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Kevin Mayer, the chief executive of the Chinese-owned video app TikTok, said on Wednesday that he was resigning after the company came under sustained pressure from the Trump administration over its ties to China.

title: As Young Black Athletes Call for Racial Awakening, Some N.F.L. Retirees Declare Fealty to Winner Trump
description: On one of the most consequential nights in recent sports history  when a player-led boycott forced the N.B.A. to postpone playoff games  the Republican National Convention offered pro-Trump testimonials from a retired Notre Dame coach and a former N.F.L. player facing insider-trading charges.

title: Highlights From the Republican National Convention: Night 3
description: Mike Pence officially accepted the nomination for vice president. In a speech from Fort McHenry in Baltimore, Mr. Pence emphasized law and order and acknowledged the protests about race relations nationwide.

title: Republicans Insist Only Trump Can Stop This Chaos. But Hes in Charge Now.
description: The America that many speakers described on Wednesday at the Republican National Convention did not sound like a desirable place: fractious, violent, functionally lawless in some pockets.

title: Hurricane Laura Kills at Least 6 People in Louisiana
description: Hurricane Laura, which began the day rolling ashore as one of the strongest storms ever to hit Louisiana, plowed trough the state from south to north, gradually weakening to become a tropical storm but wreaking destruction all along its path and killing at least six people before the afternoon was through.

title: A Drama With a 100-Year Festival History Gets an Update
description: SALZBURG, Austria  Theres a special charge to a morality play performed in the midst of a pandemic.

title: Stephen Colbert Refuses to Watch Night 3 of the R.N.C.
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Fending for Yourself
description: Tiffany writes: I asked my husband if I should make dinner for both of us or if we should fend for ourselves. My husband chose fend for ourselves. He ended up making ramen. We had one small steak left, which I made for myself. My husband said it wasnt fair that I had steak while he had ramen. Is he right?

title: A Strange Rash Had Doctors Stumped. Was It an Insect Bite?
description: The 73-year-old man looked up at the clear summer sky  the morning was nearly gone. He had finished mowing the main part of his lawn and was trimming the edges near the shrubbery with the weed wacker. He wanted to finish before the sun and heat made the work too hard. Suddenly he felt a sharp sting on the lower part of his shin. He glanced down at his bare leg. Nothing there. He still had the hedges to trim, so he kept working. He quickly finished the needed pruning, then moved on to the inside tasks he had planned.

title: These Roommates Scoured Brooklyn for a Place With Great Amenities. Now They Can't Use Them.
description: Two cousins went looking for a rental building with a gym and common workspaces, among other (now unusable) perks. Which one would you choose?

title: How Dr. Fauci Found Himself Talking to Julia Roberts, Lil Wayne and Just About Any Podcaster Who Asked
description: With the White House blocking the way to network news, Dr. Fauci talks about the pandemic wherever he can.

title: The Racial Anxiety Lurking Behind Reaction Videos
description: For decades, the drum break in Phil Collinss In the Air Tonight has been making listeners reach for their adjectives. The barrage of tom-tom hits, which comes almost four minutes into Collinss 1981 single, has elicited rock-critic clichs from bone-crunching to iconic. Complex magazine called it notoriously brilliant; the website The Quietus unholstered its hyphens, describing aPhil-falling-down-the-stairs-with-his-kit explosion. In 2009, Ozzy Osbourne declared the drum fill the best ever.

title: The Best Book Jill Lepore Ever Got as a Present Is One She Hates
description: [The Best Books of 2020: View our full list.]

title: Dont Call Him Wimpy! Jeff Kinney Repaired His Own Vehicle on His Book Tour
description: DIARY OF AN INTREPID AUTHOR Jeff Kinney is the rare writer who speaks of his work in the collective voice  for instance, We realized in the spring that having a book out in the height of a pandemic might not be the best thing so we decided to delay it. But last month the Diary of a Wimpy Kid creator was on his own when he embarked on a nine-day tour to promote his new novel, Rowley Jeffersons Awesome Friendly Adventure, now at No. 1 on the childrens middle grade hardcover list. Equipped with a Wimpy Kid mask and an extra-long grabber for passing copies to customers, he drove an orange cargo van (a futuristic ice-cream truck) from Pennsylvania to Vermont, braving storms and downed trees along the way.

title: Massage Therapy Without the Touch
description: After the coronavirus lockdowns took hold in March, Suzanne Kwasniewski, a licensed massage therapist in Saratoga Springs, N.Y., began calling her regular clients every week or two, at first just to see how they were doing. When I spoke with some of my regulars, particularly those Ive known a long time, I picked things up in their voices, she said. Sometimes it was fear and frustration. Other times she sensed deep-seated emotional distress.

title: New & Noteworthy, From Angels to American Cuisine
description: THE APPOINTMENT, by Katharina Volckmer. (Avid Reader, $22.) In a furious comic monologue to her gynecologist , the German-born narrator of this debut novel riffs on national shame, family secrets, sex and more with a disregard for propriety worthy of Alexander Portnoy.

title: Poem: Ode to the Oranges of Jaffa
description: What if orchards could tell the histories? What if lizards, stones, rivers, hand-dug wells were talked to when compiling archives? After reading and listening to testimonies by Nahida Halaby Gordon, whose family was forced from their home in Jaffa, Palestine, in 1948, Philip Metres composed haunting poems for Returning to Jaffa, drawing on her memories and witness. Theyre particularly searing to read during days when annexation of the occupied West Bank is bandied about like a bargaining chip and people make decisions for other peoples lands with no just resolution. I looked long and hard for a phrase like Arab-Jewish cooperation in a poem. Its not impossible. Selected by Naomi Shihab Nye

title: Power and Passage: New Science Fiction and Fantasy
description: The discourse about reading fiction during the pandemic has followed two broad tracks: There are those who take comfort in the activity, and those who have found reading impossibly difficult. I belong to the latter camp, but Im all the more excited to share the following books, which, while very different in genre and mode, shook me out of listless distraction with their originality.

title: Can the Republicans Sell a Whole New Trump?
description: Listen and subscribe to The Argument from your mobile device:

title: Could It Be Bush v. Gore All Over Again?
description: This is not a column about a case thats pending at the Supreme Court  yet.

title: The Islanders Goalie Entered With a Shutout Streak. He Left on the Bench.
description: TORONTO  Suddenly, the Islanders focus has shifted, from the confidence in a franchise record-setting goaltender, to having concerns about how Semyon Varlamov will bounce back from his worst performance of the N.H.L. postseason on Wednesday.

title: Rev. Roxy Is Serious About Marriages and Helping Make Them Work
description: The Rev. Roxanne Birchfield, 36, a minister of the Evangelical Church Alliance and the founder and owner of Married By Rev. Roxy, an officiating and premarital counseling service in Brooklyn, has become a high-profile officiant, performing ceremonies on hit reality shows like Netflixs Love Is Blind, VH1s Love & Hip Hop and Married at First Sight.

title: Youre Beginning to Look Dull
description: It has been a weird summer, many of us cooped up indoors, and our skin has noticed. Now, in these last weeks of the season, skin care obsessives as well as the more laid-back among us are getting sick of the dull skin that has become something of a hallmark of the pandemic.

title: Wildfires, Pandemic, Earthquakes. Whats Next for California?
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  Every other week for the past 18 years, my wife and I have made a five-hour round-trip drive between here and Mendocino County. She has a health care practice in both places, so our rural home isnt a retreat; nonetheless, like others who had the option, when the pandemic kicked in we opted for the country, where social distance is axiomatic and anxiety less likely.

title: Parenting in Front of a Live Audience of In-laws
description: Somewhere in rural Pennsylvania, my husband and I whisper-argue on a mattress strewn across the floor. His hand gestures say, Lower your voice. Mine say, Im a big-haired Spanish woman from Jersey. Fat chance.

title: My Job? Telling People What Happens Next
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Over 100 Ex-Staff Members for John McCain Endorse Joe Biden
description: WASHINGTON  More than 100 former staff members for Senator John McCain are supporting Joseph R. Biden Jr., a show of support across the political divide that they hope amplifies the Country First credo of the former Arizona senator.

title: Late Housing Payments and Coronavirus
description: Nearly six months into the pandemic, the share of American homeowners and renters who have missed or been late with their monthly housing payments is holding steady, despite government stimulus initiatives and protections including the CARES Act.

title: Is Social Security Becoming a Pawn in the Postal Service Crisis?
description: Top Democrats are warning that the problems afflicting the United States Postal Service pose a threat to more than voting rights  a slowdown in services, they say, will also hurt seniors who rely on letter carriers for Social Security checks, medications and other critical mail.

title: 3 Major Themes From Night 3 of the R.N.C.: Watch the Highlights
description: Adam Nagourney: The third night of the Republican National Convention took place against a backdrop of staggering tumult in the country: the demonstrations and shootings in Kenosha, Wis., the devastating hurricane approaching the Gulf Coast. The big question was whether the speakers would at last mention these issues. The answer, particularly with Vice President Mike Pences speech, was yes, they were mentioned.

title: My Familys Shrouded History Is Also a National One for Korea
description: In the latest article from Beyond the World War II We Know, a series by The Times that documents lesser-known stories from World War II, the author Alexander Chee looks back at the dark legacy of the Japanese occupation of Korea  and a once-unknown personal connection to it.

title: Desperate to Leave Beirut, Young Lebanese Are Also the Ones Fixing It
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The scooter engines snorted out, and Sara el-Sayed swung herself down to the pavement outside the third damaged building she had visited that afternoon, two carpenters in tow.

title: Trash Piles Up in Parks, Just When New Yorkers Need Them the Most
description: In a playground in the Morrisania section of the Bronx on a recent afternoon, two parents kept their toddler strapped in her stroller, afraid she might pick up the hamburger wrappers,  cigarettes or hypodermic needle lying on the pavement.

title: College Footballs Pandemic Playbook: Fewer Fans, No Tailgating, No Bands
description: At Texas A&M, the football stadium that normally holds about 110,000 people may allow fewer than 28,000 to start this season. Alabama and Auburn banned tailgating, and so did Mississippis governor. Marching bands are forbidden on the Atlantic Coast Conferences fields, suites at Texas will not have self-service buffets and from Baylor to Boston College, hand sanitizer will be more common than printed tickets.

title: Intel Slips, and a High-Profile Supercomputer Is Delayed
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  When it selected Intel to help build a $500 million supercomputer last year, the Energy Department bet that computer chips made in the United States could help counter a technology challenge from China.

title: Move Over, Sustainable Travel. Regenerative Travel Has Arrived.
description: Tourism, which grew faster than the global gross domestic product for the past nine years, has been decimated by the pandemic. Once accounting for 10 percent of employment worldwide, the sector is poised to shed 121 million jobs, with losses projected at a minimum of $3.4 trillion, according to the World Travel & Tourism Council.

title: What if the First Coronavirus Vaccines Arent the Best?
description: Seven months into the coronavirus crisis, with more than 30 vaccines rapidly advancing through the rigorous stages of clinical trials, a surprising number of research groups are placing bets on some that have not yet been given to a single person.

title: Flix Fnon, the Collector-Anarchist Who Was Seurats First Champion
description: Every exhibition tells a story, usually about an artist or groups of them. Occasionally, however, some shows focus on non-artists: individuals who work as art dealers, curators, critics or collectors. Essential to a functioning art world, they dont make things. They make things happen.

title: 15 Books to Watch For in September
description: When readers meet Ursula Kuczynski Burton, a.k.a. Agent Sonya, a decorated intelligence agent and colonel in Russias Red Army, shes living undercover as a housewife in a small English village. All that her neighbors know about her is that she makes great scones; they dont realize shes funneling atomic secrets from Britain and the U.S. to the Soviet Union. Macintyre, the best-selling author of several books about spies, offers a rich portrait of Burton, who was involved in some of the 20th centurys most famous espionage operations.

title: In Michigans Upper Peninsula, Some Cracks Emerge in the Pro-Trump Wall
description: ST. IGNACE, Mich.  Michigans Upper Peninsula is known for many things: its enviable location, nestled among three of the five Great Lakes  Huron, Superior and Michigan; hundreds of waterfalls and vast expanses of lush forests; and pasties, a concoction of meat, potatoes and vegetables enrobed in dough that served as a portable meal for those heading into the copper and iron ore mines.

title: Turkey Braces for Yet Another Currency Crisis
